docs.title: Dev Scoreboard
docs.text: This is a utility project that helps keep developers accountable to themselves.

docs.title: Current Features
docs.text: See the Roadmap for a list of features that are planned.

docs.title: About
docs.text: This is a final project for the couse "Wearabale & Ubiquitous Computing" at the University of Arkansas in Fayetteville.

docs.title: Project Description
docs.text: This project is a scoreboard that is used to keep track of the number of commits and pull requests that a developer has made. The scoreboard is a Raspberry Pi that is connected to a servo motor. The servo motor is connected to a candy dispenser. When a developer makes a commit or pull request, the servo motor is activated and candy is dispensed. The scoreboard is connected to a web application that is used to keep track of the number of commits and pull requests that a developer has made. The web application is also used to add and remove developers from the scoreboard.

docs.title: How does this website work?
docs.text: This website is built using Jekyll. It uses GitHub Pages to host the website.

docs.title: What theme is this?
docs.text: This website uses the Material for MkDocs theme.

docs.title: Hardware Required
docs.text:
• 1x Raspberry Pi 3 Model B

  • 1x Servo Motor

  • 1x Candy Dispenser

  • 1x USB Microphone

  • 1x XBox 360 Kintect

  • 5x 5k Ohm Resistors

  • 4x LEDs

  • 5x Jumper Wires

docs.title: Hardware Setup
docs.text: Below are a few different electrical diagrams that show how to connect the hardware together. The diagrams are for the Raspberry Pi 3 Model B, but the same principles apply to the Raspberry Pi 2 Model B.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Clone this repository and install the dependencies.

git clone https://github.com/hulohot/dev-scoreboard

Change to the dev-scoreboard directory.

cd dev-scoreboard

Install the Python3 dependencies.

pip3 install -r requirements.txt
